multiple_choice.question: Jem broke his arm badly at the elbow when he was nearly how old, according to the narrator in Chapter 1?
How many years older is Jem than his sister Scout?
In Chapter 1, the narrator says, "Being Southerners, it was a source of shame to some members of the family that we had no recorded ancestors on either side of" what battle?
Simon Finch is described in Chapter 1 as a fur-trapping apothecary from what location?
What is the name of the homestead that Simon Finch established for himself in Alabama?
According to the narrator in Chapter 1, where did Atticus Finch go to study law?
Where does Dill live during the school year?
What grade in school is Scout starting in Chapter 2?
What grade is Jem starting school in Chapter 2?
What is the name of Scout's schoolteacher in Chapter 2?
What county in Alabama does Scout's schoolteacher say she's from in Chapter 2?
On what date did Alabama secede from the Union during the Civil War era?
How much money does Scout's teacher offer to loan to the little boy who has no lunch with him in Chapter 2?
What is the name of the little boy that has no lunch with him at school in Chapter 2?
What does Walter Cunningham pour all over his food that causes Scout to exclaim in Chapter 3?
Who invites Walter Cunningham to come to the Finch home for dinner in Chapter 3?
How does Scout say Calpurnia's grammar changes whenever she is furious in Chapter 3?
Where does Calpurnia make Scout eat the rest of her dinner after she's insulted Walter in Chapter 3?
Where does Scout threaten to go and drown herself in Chapter 3?
Who is the little boy that Scout's teacher sees a "cootie" crawling on in Chapter 3?
What does Atticus say the Ewell family patriarch spends his relief checks on in Chapter 3?
At what time does Scout get out of school each day in Chapter 4?
What does Scout find in the knothole of the oak tree at the Radley Place in the beginning of Chapter 4?
What items are contained in the jewelry box that Scout and Jem find in the knothole in Chapter 4?
Who lives at the far end of Scout's street next door to the post office in Chapter 4?
Who is described in Chapter 4 as "the meanest old woman who ever lived"?
Scout says in Chapter 4 that the train stop called Maycomb Junction is actually in what county?
Who picks up Dill at the train station in Maycomb's one taxi in Chapter 4?
What does Miss Maudie detest growing in her yard?
What is Dill's real name?
What does Miss Maudie say Boo Radley's name is in Chapter 5?
What is the name of Atticus Finch's brother?
What was the name of Miss Maudie's father?
What household pets does Jem suggest Boo Radley eats in Chapter 5?
What does Jem use to try to deliver a message to Boo Radley in Chapter 5?
Scout says in Chapter 6 that Mr. Avery boards a room across the street from whose house?
What does Jem tell Scout to not get tangled up with in the garden as the children steal into the Radley yard in Chapter 6?
What does Jem get his pants caught on as the children run from the Radley yard in Chapter 6?
What is the first name of the elder Mr. Radley?
Scout says in Chapter 6 that "Matches were dangerous, but" what "were fatal"?
Dill tells Atticus that he won Jem's pants playing what game in Chapter 6?
At what time does Jem sneak out of the house to go get his pants in Chapter 6?
What grade is Scout beginning in school in Chapter 7?
What time does Scout get out of school each day in Chapter 7?
What is the first object that Jem and Scout see in the knothole of the oak tree in Chapter 7?
Jem tells Scout in Chapter 7 that it wasn't until he reached what grade that he learned anything of value in school?
The little figurines of a boy and girl that Scout and Jem find in the tree in Chapter 7 are carved from what material?
The medal that Scout and Jem find in the knothole of the oak tree in Chapter 7 is one that was awarded for what achievement?
In the beginning of Chapter 8, Scout says that Maycomb County is experiencing the coldest winter since what year?
Scout claims in Chapter 8 that "Mr. Avery said it was written on the Rosetta Stone that when children disobeyed their parents, smoked cigarettes and made war on each other," what would happen?
What does Scout observe for the first time that makes her scream for Atticus saying that the world is ending in Chapter 8?
Who is the telephone operator that calls Atticus to tell him that school has been canceled in Chapter 8?
At what time in the night does Atticus awaken Scout because of the fire on the block in Chapter 8?
Whose house has caught fire in Chapter 8?
Who does Scout almost come to blows with on the playground because he insults Atticus in the beginning of Chapter 9?
Atticus tells Scout not to use the "n" word because it is what, in Chapter 9?
What ailment does Scout try to get from Miss Rachel's cook's son by rubbing her head against his head in Chapter 9?
Who does Atticus say was kind enough to grant a postponement on the trial in Chapter 9?
Who is described in Chapter 9 as "Maycomb County’s sole surviving Confederate veteran"?
Of whom does Scout say in Chapter 9, "I decided that she had been swapped at birth, that my grandparents had perhaps received a Crawford instead of a Finch"?
How old does Scout say Atticus is in Chapter 10?
Who does Scout say taught her and Jem to shoot when they received air-rifles in Chapter 10?
When Jem and Scout were given air-rifles, Atticus told Jem that it was a sin to kill a mockingbird, but that he could shoot all of what kind of bird that he wanted?
Why does Miss Maudie tell Scout it is a sin to kill a mockingbird?
options: Because all they do is sing
Because they are the color of heaven
Because it is written in Leviticus
multiple_choice.answer: Because all they do is sing

multiple_choice.question: What game does Miss Maudie say Atticus is the best at in town in Chapter 10?
What kind of sport are the Methodists and the Baptists playing as a benefit in Chapter 10?
What does Jem intend to buy for himself with his birthday money in the beginning of Chapter 11?
The twirling baton that Scout longs for in Chapter 11 is sold at what store in town?
How much does the twirling baton cost that Scout longs for in Chapter 11?
What "dim organization on the north side of the square" does Mrs. Dubose tell Scout she'll grow up to work at in Chapter 11?
What does Jem do after Mrs. Dubose says derogatory things about Atticus and enrages him in Chapter 11?
What is the name of the black man that Atticus Finch is assigned to defend in the novel?
How old is Jem in the beginning of Chapter 12?
What does Scout ask Atticus if Jem might have when Jem's appetite grows considerably in Chapter 12?
What profession does Dill say his new father has in his letter in Chapter 12?
For how long does Atticus leave home because the legislature is called into emergency session in Chapter 12?
What is the name of Calpurnia's church that she takes Scout and Jem to in Chapter 12?
What is the name of the Maycomb trash collector that Jem and Scout see at church in Chapter 12?
On what day of the week does Aunt Alexandra arrive at the Finch household in Chapter 13?
Where is Atticus returning from in the beginning of Chapter 13?
How far is Maycomb from Finch's Landing?
What word is used in the novel to refer to homemade liquor?
Aunt Alexandra presents a book to Jem and Scout that was written by what cousin of theirs in Chapter 13?
Atticus asks Jem and Scout as he leaves their room in Chapter 13, "Do you think I'll end up costing the family" how much money?
What does Scout think is under her bed when she goes to get Jem in Chapter 14?
How much money does Dill say he took from his mother's purse in order to come to Maycomb in Chapter 14?
How many miles away from home has Dill traveled to come to Maycomb in Chapter 14?
Who does Jem go to tell that Dill has arrived at the Finch household in Chapter 14?
What word does Atticus define for Scout in Chapter 14 as "carnal knowledge of a female by force and without consent"?
What is Dill's response when Scout asks him in Chapter 14, “Why do you reckon Boo Radley’s never run off?”
options: "He's shackled to a wall, so he can't."
"He isn't smart enough to think of it."
“Maybe he doesn’t have anywhere to run off to
multiple_choice.answer: “Maybe he doesn’t have anywhere to run off to

multiple_choice.question: What is the name of the Sheriff of Maycomb County?
Who does Atticus say shamed the Ku Klux Klan away from Maycomb when they paraded around his house once in Chapter 15?
Who is the sole owner, editor and printer of The Maycomb Tribune?
What kind of car does Atticus Finch own and keep in the garage?
Who does Scout tell Mr. Cunningham to say hello to for her in Chapter 15?
Who speaks from the shadows and is revealed to be holding a double-barrel shotgun with the intention of protecting Atticus in Chapter 15?
What does Jem eat for breakfast in the beginning of Chapter 16?
Scouts says in Chapter 16, "Atticus said naming people after Confederate generals made" what?
What towns-person is described by Jem in Chapter 16 as voting "the straight Prohibition ticket"?
What lady from Maycomb is described in Chapter 16 as one who dips snuff in private?
What kind of cola does Scout describe the black attendees of the trial drinking in Chapter 16?
Of whom does Jem say in Chapter 16, "Lives by himself way down near the county line. He’s got a colored woman and all sorts of mixed chillun"?
Where is Mr. Gilmer said to be from in Chapter 17?
Who does the Sheriff say called him to the Ewell residence on the night of the alleged crime in Chapter 17?
On what date was the Sheriff contacted to go to the Ewell residence, according to his testimony in Chapter 17?
Who is Dill sitting next to in the courtroom in Chapter 17?
What is the name of the young woman who claims to have been raped by Tom Robinson in the trial?
What is noted by Atticus when he has Bob Ewell write his name before the court in Chapter 17?
What is Mayella Ewell's middle name?
How old does Mayella Ewell says she is when she takes the stand in Chapter 18?
How much money does Mayella say she offered to Tom Robinson to bust up a chiffarobe for her in Chapter 18?
How many siblings does Mayella Ewell have?
How did Tom Robinson injure his left arm, according to Reverend Sykes in Chapter 18?
options: It was caught in a well
It was amputated in a car accident
It was caught in a cotton gin
It was injured during a shooting
multiple_choice.answer: It was caught in a cotton gin

multiple_choice.question: How many witnesses does Atticus say he has for the court in the end of Chapter 18?
Who is the judge that oversees the trial of Tom Robinson?
How old is Tom Robinson when he takes the stand in Chapter 19?
How many children does Tom Robinson say he has in Chapter 19?
According to Tom Robinson's testimony, he spent thirty days in jail once before when he was convicted of what crime?
For whom does Tom Robinson say he worked at the time of the crime in Chapter 19?
What reason does Tom Robinson give for why he helped out Mayella Ewell periodically in Chapter 19?
Who does Mr. Dolphus Raymond offer a drink to in the beginning of Chapter 20?
The children discover that Mr. Dolphus Raymond is actually drinking what from his brown paper bag in Chapter 20?
What "offense" does Atticus say Mayella Ewell committed and then attempted to cover her guilt for in his final statement to the jury?
Whom does Atticus Finch insinuate actually beat up Mayella Ewell in his closing statements to the jury?
What year does Atticus Finch say it is in his closing statements in Chapter 20?
What does Atticus Finch claim are the "great levelers" and the place in this country where "all men are created equal" in Chapter 20?
When Atticus opens the envelope that Calpurnia brings him at the courtroom in Chapter 21, he tells the judge that the letter is from whom?
Who points out the children sitting in the balcony of the courtroom to Atticus in Chapter 21?
How long has the jury been out when Jem, Scout, and Dill return from eating lunch in Chapter 21?
What is the name of the court reporter who chain smokes in Chapter 21?
What is the verdict in the Tom Robinson trial in Chapter 21?
What do the black attendees of the trial do as Atticus Finch exits the courthouse in Chapter 21?
What newspaper is Atticus reading when Scout and Jem awaken in Chapter 22?
What food item does Calpurnia say Tom Robinson's father sent over to the Finch's in Chapter 22?
What dessert does Miss Maudie offer to Jem and the other children in Chapter 22?
According to the narrator in Chapter 22, "Court-appointed defenses were usually given to" what latest addition to the bar?
What does Dill say he's going to be when he grows up as Miss Rachel approaches them on the sidewalk in Chapter 22?
Who is said to have spit in Atticus's face and threatened him in Chapter 22?
What store does Miss Stephanie Crawford say she was leaving when she saw Atticus get threatened in Chapter 23?
Jem says in Chapter 23 of Atticus, "He told me havin' a gun around's an invitation" for what?
Where is Enfield Prison Farm said to be in Chapter 23?
What will happen to Tom Robinson if he loses his appeal, according to Atticus in Chapter 23?
What does Jem believe the justice system should get rid of in Chapter 23?
Jem and Scout learn in Chapter 23 that the one juror that wanted to find Tom Robinson innocent was a relative of what family?
Where have Jem and Dill gone in the beginning of Chapter 24?
What month is it in the beginning of Chapter 24?
What does Scout say "always filled me with vague apprehension and a firm desire to be elsewhere" in Chapter 24?
What word used in Chapter 24 refers to a person who pretends to have virtues, moral or religious beliefs, principles, etc., that he or she does not actually possess?
What is the name of Tom Robinson's wife?
How many bullet holes does Atticus say they found on Tom Robinson in Chapter 24?
What bug is Scout about to kill in the beginning of Chapter 25 when Jem tells her to take it outside?
Jem and Dill had been heading home from where when they'd encountered Atticus going to the Robinson home, according to Scout in Chapter 25?
What does Dill say the children were playing in front of Tom Robinson's residence when Atticus arrived in Chapter 25?
Who writes a scathing editorial in the newspaper about the Tom Robinson ordeal in Chapter 25?
Who "told Aunt Alexandra in Jem’s presence (“Oh foot, he’s old enough to listen.”) that Mr. Ewell said it made one down and about two more to go" in Chapter 25?
What word from Chapter 25 refers to generous actions or donations to aid the poor, ill, or helpless?
What grade in school has Scout begun in the beginning of Chapter 26?
Jem is in what grade in school in the beginning of Chapter 26?
Who does Cecil Jacobs describe in Chapter 26 as having "been after the Jews and he’s puttin‘ ’em in prisons and he’s taking away all their property and he won’t let any of ‘em out of the country"?
What quotation does Scout cite in Chapter 26 when her teacher asks for the definition of Democracy?
options: “‘Equal rights for all, special privileges for none.’"
"Practicing the same definition of 'fair' to everyone, regardless of color, gender, or age."
"Elected individuals to represent an entire community."
"Being fair, even when you don't want to be."
multiple_choice.answer: “‘Equal rights for all, special privileges for none.’"

multiple_choice.question: What kind of government does Miss Gates say Germany operates under in Chapter 26?
What study does Scout say she's never been a fan of in Chapter 26?
Scout says in Chapter 27 that Bob Ewell is the "only man I ever heard of who was fired from the WPA for" what?
Who does Scout refer to as the "Welfare lady" in Chapter 27?
Who has gone out of his way to make a job for Helen Robinson in Chapter 27?
What does "NRA" refer to in the novel?
Of Misses Tutti and Frutti Barber, Scout says in Chapter 27 that they "were rumored to be Republicans, having migrated from Clanton, Alabama" in what year?
What are the first names of Misses Tutti and Frutti?
What does Scout dress up as for the Halloween parade in Chapter 28?
Scout describes the lament of the bluejay in Chapter 28 as a repetitive sounding of what phrase?
How much money does Jem give to Scout to spend at the Halloween pageant in Chapter 28?
Who does Jem leave Scout to hang out with at the Halloween pageant in Chapter 28?
What is the language of the Creek Indians?
Who is killed in Chapter 28?
What does Sheriff Tate say he believes saved Scout's life in Chapter 29?
How has Jem been injured in Chapter 29?
Who does Scout point out as the person that saved her and Jem from their attacker in Chapter 29?
Who is the doctor that has been called to see to Jem in Chapter 30?
How does the Sheriff contend that Mr. Ewell died in Chapter 30?
options: He was stabbed by Boo Radley
He was shot by Scout Finch
He was stabbed by Jem Finch

multiple_choice.question: What flowers does Miss Maudie grow and obsess over in the novel?
